greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = n/(largest prime power dividing n).
comment: a(n) = smallest positive number k such that n/k is a prime power.
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(n) = 1 if n is a prime power (A000961).
a(n) = 2 if n is a twice odd prime power (A278568).
example: a(12) = 3 because 12 = 2^2*3 therefore 12/(largest prime power dividing 12) = 12/4 = 3.
program: def a003418(n): return 1 if n<1 else lcm(range(1, n + 1))
print([n//a(n) for n in range(1, 101)]) # _Indranil Ghosh_, Apr 04 2017
xref: Has same beginning as A052128 and A114536 but is strictly different from those two sequences.
results.author: _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Mar 30 2017
